title: The Faltering Escalator of Urban Opportunity
itunes:title: The Faltering Escalator of Urban Opportunity
description:
Anton Schutz, President at Mendon Capital Advisors, breaks down bank earnings. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Blomberg News Auto Reporter Keith Naughton walk through the story “The Ford Bronco Is Back, Thanks to a Group of Obsessed Employees.” We get Businessweek Economics with MIT Economist David Autor. He talks about the faltering escalator of urban opportunity. Pierre Naudé, CEO at nCino, discusses his company’s IPO and first day of trading. And we Drive to the Close with Walter Todd, President and CIO at Greenwood Capital Associates.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Doni Holloway. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
content:encoded:
Anton Schutz, President at Mendon Capital Advisors, breaks down bank earnings. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Blomberg News Auto Reporter Keith Naughton walk through the story “The Ford Bronco Is Back, Thanks to a Group of Obsessed Employees.” We get Businessweek Economics with MIT Economist David Autor. He talks about the faltering escalator of urban opportunity. Pierre Naudé, CEO at nCino, discusses his company’s IPO and first day of trading. And we Drive to the Close with Walter Todd, President and CIO at Greenwood Capital Associates.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Doni Holloway. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
